name: qualitatively
content:
qualitatively adverb
(STANDARD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to how good or bad something is: The successive levels differ qualitatively. The risks are qualitatively if not quantitatively the same.
More examplesFewer examplesThis theft of data was qualitatively different than anything we've ever seen before.This is really something that is qualitatively different.The media can help people decide if a candidate is qualitatively better or worse.

qualitatively adverb
(CHARACTERISTIC)
in a way that relates to what something or someone is like: He offered the possibility of a qualitatively new relationship. See
qualitative
More examplesFewer examplesOur system represents something qualitatively new. We are improving qualitatively the way we work together.Her vivacity is qualitatively different from almost everyone else's.

Add to word list
in a way that relates to the qualities of something rather than its quantity: History shows that a housing bust is qualitatively different than a stock bust. Compare
quantitatively
